ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: Staff code number of person completing this form
Notes: 999= Missing Data

ElementDescription: Someone has it in for me.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: I sometimes feel as if I'm being followed.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: I believe that I have often been punished without cause.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: Some people have tried to steal my ideas and take credit for them.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: My parents and family find more fault with me than they should.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: No one really cares much what happens to you.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: It is safer to trust no one.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: I have often felt that strangers were looking at me critically.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: Someone has been trying to influence my mind.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: I tend to be on my guard with people who are somewhat more friendly than I expected.
Notes: 1 = Not at all applicable; 2 = Somewhat applicable; 3 = Moderately applicable; 4 = Very much applicable; 5 = Extremely applicable

ElementDescription: People have said insulting and unkind things about me.
